Lafarge trial: A deep dive into how the cement giant made a pact with jihadists
subhead: This week, the Paris criminal court examined the issue at the heart of the much-anticipated Lafarge case: the payments made to terrorist groups from 2012 to 2014.

Putin says Russia will end war only when Ukraine retreats
Deadly Hong Kong fire kills at least 94 amid growing concern over renovation safety
subhead: The ongoing blaze has affected a complex of buildings containing 2,000 apartments. The buildings were under renovation and surrounded by bamboo scaffolding, which likely contributed to the flames' rapid spread. More than 250 people remain missing.

title: Trump says Venezuela anti-drug operations 'by land' to begin 'soon'
subhead: President Trump announced during Thanksgiving remarks to deployed US troops that efforts to halt Venezuelan drug trafficking 'by land' would begin 'very soon.' The US military has carried out a series of airstrikes against boats it claims were trafficking drugs in international waters, without providing further evidence.

title: Pope Leo XIV joins Orthodox leader in Turkey to jointly celebrate early Church milestone
subhead: On Thursday, the American pope began his four-day visit to Turkey, where he will meet the Patriarch Bartholomew I of Constantinople, the leader of the world's Orthodox Christians. Leo held talks with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, urging him to embrace Turkey's role as mediator amid global instability.

title: Mexico's new Frida Kahlo museum bends the truth
subhead: Since opening to the public this fall in Mexico City, a new museum devoted to painter Frida Kahlo has sparked a series of controversies. Contrary to claims by its owners, the house was never the home of the Kahlo family, and a mural discovered on site was likely not the artist's creation.

Leo XIV to visit Turkey and Lebanon on his first papal trip
subhead: On his debut on the international stage, the head of the Catholic Church will celebrate the 1,700th anniversary of the Council of Nicaea on Lake Iznik, at the invitation of the patriarch of Constantinople. The stop in Lebanon gives him the opportunity to send a message to a region in crisis.

title: Forgotten Louvre security report highlighted specific balcony used by crown jewel thieves
subhead: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.

title: Why our old clothes end up in the UAE
subhead: The country has emerged as a leader in sorting secondhand clothing, taking advantage of Europe's inability to process its own stockpiles. This outsourcing comes with clear environmental and social costs.
